odeComponent.htmlView:
In this learning project, you will explore different eco-friendly and sustainable solutions that can help make a school greener and more responsible.

Throughout Sessions 1 to 5, you will receive input through videos, texts and listening activities, and you will complete practical tasks that will gradually prepare you for the final challenge.These activities will help you develop your ideas, improve your English skills, and create materials that you will later use in your final project. Make the most of your potential by staying active, creative and collaborative during each session. 

Now you are probably asking yourself: What is the final product?
Your final task is to design and present your Eco-School of the year 2100 through a creative and persuasive video. You will explain how technology and human responsibility can work together to make your school more sustainable.

Don‚Äôt worry if you are not sure how to start ‚Äî this learning project will give you all the tools, information and guidance you need, step by step.

Are you ready to learn loads of new things? Believe in yourself! Time to get round to work! üßë‚Äçüíª ‚ò∫Ô∏è

To help you visualise your work, take a look at this timeline:

Evaluation:

odeNavStructureProperty.value: Session 1. From Sci-Fi Dreams to Real Technology: How The Jetsons Predicted Today‚Äôs Eco-problems and Technology
Session 1. From Sci-Fi Dreams to Real Technology: How The Jetsons Predicted Today‚Äôs Eco-problems and Technology

odeComponent.htmlView:
Timing
01:00
Persons involved
Individual Task

In this session, you will travel from the past to the futureüîÆ!  You are going to watch short clips from The Jetsons, a famous animated series that imagined life in the future many years ago. While watching, you will discover technologies that once seemed impossible and think about how they affect our lives today üíªüì±üì∏. To carry out the tasks from this session, you will use this Google Sheet.

Warm Up and Task 1: Audiovisual Comprehension. You will watch short video fragments from The Jetsons and complete comprehension activities. Pay attention to the inventions, the way the main characters live, and how technology is used in everyday life. Compare it to your reality and suggest some inventions that would make your school more eco-friendly.

odeComponent.htmlView:
Task 2: Cause‚ÄìEffect Reflection.

It¬¥s time to do the POST-TASK activity from the Google Sheet.

Write a short reflection about your choices using a cause‚Äìeffect structure. Think about the inventions you suggested for school in the previous task:

  • Which inventions are the most useful and beneficial?
  • Which inventions are attractive but could make students and teachers more sedentary or lazy?
  • Explain why and what effects these inventions could have.¬†

But before you start, match each card with its pair to practise useful cause-effect vocabulary for your writing.

Once you finish your writing, you need to make sure that you:

  • completed the tasks in a shared Google Sheets worksheet.
  • gave access to your teacher so it can be checked.
  • sent the link to your teacher.

GOOD LUCK!¬†

odePagStructure.blockName: Explore eco-projects and share your ideas on a forum.

odeComponent.htmlView:
Timing
00:50
Persons involved
Individual work

Main task: Exploring Eco-School Projects

First, you need to explore eco-projects from the following websites:

  • The Eco-Schools website (UK) - you need to choose the topic, click on it and explore the projects. 
  • The Eco-School project from C√°diz (El Altillo International School)

Now, you need to decide which of them are the most appealing and which you would like to implement in your school. Choose:

  • One project from a UK school
  • One project from the school in C√°diz

For each project, explain:

  • Why you chose it (What benefits it could bring? Why would it be useful in your school context?)
  • How it could be applied in your own school (Be specific, adapt it to you school reality)

Finally, share your ideas in the Google Classroom forum and comment on at least one classmate‚Äôs post sharing your views about their choice. Remember to respect the netiquette rules.

odeNavStructure.pageName: Session 4: Smart Technology vs Human Responsibility

odeNavStructureProperty.value: Session 4: Smart Technology vs Human Responsibility
Session 4: Smart Technology vs Human Responsibility

odePagStructure.blockName: Reflecting on eco, smart and healthy solutions

odeComponent.htmlView:
Timing
00:50
Persons involved
Team work

Technology can help us‚Ä¶ but should it do everything for us? In this session, you will discuss how robots and smart technology could be used in school without making people lazy or inactive.

TASK: Work with your team and get closer to finish your final campaign.

Discuss the following aspects:

  • What kind of robots or smart technology would you include in your school?
  • To avoid a sedentary lifestyle but still ensure eco-friendly environment at school: What tasks should robots do? What tasks should humans do?

After the discussion, create one slide in Canva with:

  • A table or diagram
  • Clear tasks for robots and humans
  • A short justification for your choices

odePagStructure.blockName: Reflecting on eco, smart and healthy solutions

odeComponent.htmlView:
Timing
00:50
Persons involved
Team work

Now, watch a video about green spaces and sustainable school life and make notes about the main benefits of green spaces.


Then, design the Green Zone of your school, including ideas such as:

  • School garden (vegetables, herbs, care and maintenance)
  • Green roofs (goals and types of plants)
  • Sustainable canteen (local food, less plastic, composting)

Search for information online and prepare one Canva slide for your final video presentation.

odeComponent.htmlView:
Finally, it‚Äôs time to bring all your ideas together and create something powerful! 
You will design and present your Eco-School of the year 2100 through a creative and persuasive video-presentation.

Step 1: Planning the Final Video

In your group plan your final video and write a script

Think about:

  • Tone and atmosphere
  • Gestures and intonation
  • Key vocabulary about sustainability and technology

Your video should be an eco-campaign explaining the most important changes for your school. Combine:

  • Scenes of group members speaking
  • Images and slides from your presentation
  • Other images (remember to respect the licenses). You can use banks of pictures such as: Pixabay or Freepik. 

Before you use any picture revise the basic rules here.

Step 2: SWOT Analysis

Prepare a SWOT analysis (Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities, Threats) as one more slide in Canva. Explain which ideas are realistic and could be applied in a real school. This step is important to determine whether your plan is realistic and likely to succeed or at risk of failing.

If you‚Äôre not sure how to start this task, you can read this guide in Spanish or this in English on how to carry it out in a company (here, you don‚Äôt need to think about a company, but about your own Eco-school project). 


Source of the picture: Professional Academy
